div.p: From George Mortimer to Charles Gavan Duffy
B72/1127, unit 618, VPRS 3991 inward registered correspondence VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Having been given to understand that certain alterations and arrangements are about to take place with reference to the Botanic Gardens of Victoria, I take the liberty of bringing my name under your consideration for an appointment in that department. I beg to state that I have had considerable experience in the propagation and management of Plants of all kinds for the last twenty years, and for the last six years have had the sole charge of the rare and beautiful collection of Plants of T.S. Mort Esqr Greenoaks during wich time I have given every satisfaction in the performance of my duties.
It is but right that I should state that I am leaving Mr. Morts in consequence of his closing the establishment and presented his plants to the Botanic Gardens Sydney.
His absence from Sydney prevents me obtaining from him a Certificate and recomendation.

I am known to Messr. John Baptist & Son Nurseryman Chas Moore Esqr. Botanic Gardens. John Sutherland Esqr [...] L.A. Malcolm McHurdy Esqr., English Chartered Bank of Australia, each and all of whom I am quite certain will cheerfully bear testimony to my character and ability.
Trusting you will take my application under your kind consideration.
